title: Noam Chomsky: 17th Century Reasoning on the Suppression of Language in Apes
description: In a MIT +150 discussion on linguistics Noam shares a funny anecdote related to the previous speakers comments on the potential of genes related to the suppression of language. He shares that it was a well researched notion by prominent intellectuals in the 17th century that apes suppressed language to avoid capture and enslavement. A folly which was postulated to have befel their negro counterparts.
